name: CreateWebhookSubscription
description:
Create a webhook subscription for events in Calendly.

Use this tool to set up a webhook subscription for either an organization, user, or group. It triggers on specified events like invitee creation or cancellation. Useful for integrating Calendly events with other applications or systems.

parameters.name: callback_url
parameters.description: The endpoint URL to receive POST requests for subscribed events in Calendly.

value_schema.description: The URL where you want to receive POST requests for events you are subscribed to.

parameters.name: event_subscriptions
parameters.description: List of user events to subscribe to. Examples include 'invitee.created', 'invitee.canceled', etc.

value_schema.description: List of user events to subscribe to.

parameters.name: organization_reference
parameters.description: The unique reference identifier for the organization associated with the webhook.

value_schema.description: The unique reference to the organization that the webhook will be tied to.

parameters.name: webhook_subscription_scope
parameters.description: Specifies the scope of the webhook subscription: "organization", "user", or "group".

value_schema.description: Indicates if the webhook subscription scope will be "organization" or "user"

parameters.name: user_reference
parameters.description: The unique reference or ID of the user for whom the webhook will be tied.

value_schema.description: The unique reference to the user that the webhook will be tied to.

parameters.name: group_reference
parameters.description: The unique reference to the group that the webhook will be tied to.

value_schema.description: The unique reference to the group that the webhook will be tied to.

parameters.name: webhook_signing_key
parameters.description: Optional secret key shared between your application and Calendly for verifying webhook signatures. Useful for ensuring webhook messages' authenticity.

value_schema.description: Optional secret key shared between your application and Calendly. See https://developer.calendly.com/api-docs/ZG9jOjM2MzE2MDM4-webhook-signatures for additional information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the calendly API.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL where you want to receive POST requests for events you are subscribed to.

value_schema.description: The URL where you want to receive POST requests for events you are subscribed to.

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: List of user events to subscribe to.

value_schema.description: List of user events to subscribe to.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The unique reference to the organization that the webhook will be tied to.

value_schema.description: The unique reference to the organization that the webhook will be tied to.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The unique reference to the user that the webhook will be tied to.

value_schema.description: The unique reference to the user that the webhook will be tied to.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: The unique reference to the group that the webhook will be tied to.

value_schema.description: The unique reference to the group that the webhook will be tied to.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Indicates if the webhook subscription scope will be "organization" or "user"

value_schema.description: Indicates if the webhook subscription scope will be "organization" or "user"

parameters.name: signing_key
parameters.description: Optional secret key shared between your application and Calendly. See https://developer.calendly.com/api-docs/ZG9jOjM2MzE2MDM4-webhook-signatures for additional information.

value_schema.description: Optional secret key shared between your application and Calendly. See https://developer.calendly.com/api-docs/ZG9jOjM2MzE2MDM4-webhook-signatures for additional information.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
